page.title: 05LAW AND ORDER
page.content: Walsall Road Police Station opened in 1968 is now just for beat officers of Â£C'Division, policemen who walk around a certain area every day whilst they are on duty.Policemen use two-way radios to keep them in touch with their base;they are able to call assistance very quickly or check out imformation by tuning into the police national computer.James told P.C O,Loughlin his father's car number which was checked out and reported back giving colour,type and owner's address within one minute. Officers visit the schools on their Â£beat'and talk to the children about the work of the police force or they help with project work. P.C Evans introduced a Â£Crime Watch' at Glenmead School and he posted up stolen car numbers for the children to watch out for.
